E

enoughFuel() - Method in class Car
This method simply returns a boolean indicating the state of the fuel tank inside a Car the state of the fuel tank is either there is an enough amount of fuel inside to apply the move in this case it returns true or the amount is not sufficient then it returns false.
enoughFuel() - Method in class Truck
This method simply returns a boolean indicating the state of the fuel tank inside a Truck the state of the fuel tank is either there is an enough amount of fuel inside to apply the move in this case it returns true or the amount is not sufficient then it returns false.
enoughFuel() - Method in class Vehicle
This method simply returns a boolean indicating the state of the fuel tank inside a vehicle the state of the fuel tank is either there is an enough amount of fuel inside to apply the move in this case it returns true or the amount is not sufficient then it returns false.

FuelException - Exception in <Unnamed>
 
FuelException(String) - Constructor for exception FuelException
 
FuelSorter - Class in <Unnamed>
A beautiful class that implements Comparator interface It has one method called compare that takes two objects of type Vehicles and does integer comparison to their fuel amounts In order to sort them in the descending order before printing the Vehicle with the largest amount of fuel at the end of the simulation.
FuelSorter() - Constructor for class FuelSorter

main(String[]) - Static method in class SimplifiedMain
 
Move - Class in <Unnamed>
 
moveVehicle(Move, Cell[][]) - Method in class Vehicle
after this method is being called by the apply method it does the actual action of moving to the corresponding grid cell Since all the moves are valid, the target cell is guaranteed to be either a car or a truck, the move is being applied just by changing the (x,y) coords for the target cell.

N
